instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  restarting during boot.
threads.message:
The board powers on fine but gets stuck with around 70% on the boot progress bar. The fans also gradually start spinning to a far higher RPM than normal. After a short while, it then simply reboots. Alt + D doesn't show any issues.

Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  restarting during boot.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  restarting during boot.
threads.message: Thank you. We've tried it again with a cleaned ME region and while it did manage to boot into an installation media, the installation of High Sierra took ages. The system now only boots to 90% and stays there indefinitely.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  restarting during boot.
threads.message: How did you clean ME region?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  restarting during boot.
threads.message:
Hi, sorry for the late reply. 

We have found a BIOS dump with a clean ME Region and flashed it. 

There so far has not been any further progress on the device.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  restarting during boot.
threads.message:
Don't say from vinafix...
Upload somewhere original BIOS read from your board.
I hope you did backup!
And buy Medusa programmer, if you deal with Apple stuff...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  restarting during boot.
threads.message: Did you try a new battery?
